author: Staff Reporter
text:
The District Mahila Court on Thursday sentenced a youth from West Bengal to life imprisonment for killing his pregnant wife at a godown of a private shop where he worked.

Additional Public Prosecutor R. Sarojini said that A. Mahaboob Ali (19) of Kalingapur, near Darjeeling, had married Nima Lhamu Bhutia (19), his college mate against the wishes of their family members on October 2014.

With the help of her cousin Toptin Bhutia (26), who was working in a a leading hotel in Coimbatore, the couple came here shortly after the marriage.

Mahaboob got a job in a sports outlet on the Variety Hall Road. Nima was an assistant in a beauty parlour run by Toptin’s wife Minura Bhutia.

Financial problems

When financial difficulties cropped up, Mahaboob asked Nima to sign divorce papers. Nima, who was pregnant, refused to do so.

On December 30, 2014, he asked her to come to the shop where he worked to talk about the matter.

With the permission of his employer N. Dinesh Kumar (42) he took her to the third floor of a nearby building where the shop’s godown was located and attacked her using a knife. Then he strangulated her to death using the wire of a pedestal fan.

On a complaint lodged by Dinesh Kumar, the police arrested Mahaboob.Mahila Court judge G. Raja slapped a fine of Rs. 5,000 too on him.
title: Teenaged boy gets life term for killing pregnant wife
